title: GeomorphologicFeature
description: A geomorphologic feature is a kind of <font color="#4f81bd">GeologicFeature</font> describing the shape and nature of the Earth's land surface. These landforms may be created by natural Earth processes (e.g., river channel, beach, moraine or mountain) or through human (anthropogenic) activity (e.g., dredged channel, reclaimed land, mine waste dumps).  In GeoSciML, the geomorphologic feature is modelled as a feature related (through <font color="#4f81bd">unitDescription</font> property) to a <font color="#4f81bd">GeologicUnit</font> that composes the form.

observationMethod-1.title: observationMethod
observationMethod-1.description:
The <font color="#4f81bd">GeologicFeature</font> observationMethod (<font color="#4f81bd">SWE::Category</font>) specifies the approach to acquiring the collection of attribute values that constitute an individual feature instance (e.g. point count, brunton compass on site, air photo interpretation, field observation, hand specimen, laboratory, aerial photography, creative imagination). 
<font color="#4f81bd">ObservationMethod</font> is a convenience property that provides a simple approach to observation metadata when data are reported using a feature view (as opposed to observation view).  This property corresponds (loosely) to ISO19115 Lineage.

observationMethod-2.title: observationMethod
observationMethod-2.description:
The <font color="#4f81bd">GeologicFeature</font> observationMethod (<font color="#4f81bd">SWE::Category</font>) specifies the approach to acquiring the collection of attribute values that constitute an individual feature instance (e.g. point count, brunton compass on site, air photo interpretation, field observation, hand specimen, laboratory, aerial photography, creative imagination). 
<font color="#4f81bd">ObservationMethod</font> is a convenience property that provides a simple approach to observation metadata when data are reported using a feature view (as opposed to observation view).  This property corresponds (loosely) to ISO19115 Lineage.

observationMethod-3.title: observationMethod
observationMethod-3.description:
The <font color="#4f81bd">GeologicFeature</font> observationMethod (<font color="#4f81bd">SWE::Category</font>) specifies the approach to acquiring the collection of attribute values that constitute an individual feature instance (e.g. point count, brunton compass on site, air photo interpretation, field observation, hand specimen, laboratory, aerial photography, creative imagination). 
<font color="#4f81bd">ObservationMethod</font> is a convenience property that provides a simple approach to observation metadata when data are reported using a feature view (as opposed to observation view).  This property corresponds (loosely) to ISO19115 Lineage.

occurrence-1.title: occurrence
occurrence-1.description: The occurrence property is an association that links a notional geologic feature with any number of mapped features (MappedFeature).  A geologic feature, such as a geologic unit may be linked to mapped features from a number of different maps.

occurrence-2.title: occurrence
occurrence-2.description: The occurrence property is an association that links a notional geologic feature with any number of mapped features (MappedFeature).  A geologic feature, such as a geologic unit may be linked to mapped features from a number of different maps.

occurrence-3.title: occurrence
occurrence-3.description: The occurrence property is an association that links a notional geologic feature with any number of mapped features (MappedFeature).  A geologic feature, such as a geologic unit may be linked to mapped features from a number of different maps.

purpose.title: purpose
purpose.description: The property purpose:DescriptionPurpose specifies the intended purpose/level of abstraction for a given feature or object instance. The possible values are: instance, typicalNorm, and definingNorm.

relatedFeature-1.title: relatedFeature
relatedFeature-1.description: A relatedFeature is a general structure used to define relationships between any features or objects within GeoSciML. Relationships are always binary and directional.  There is always a single source and a single target for a given FeatureRelation (which is abstract in GeoSciML Basic).  The relationship is always defined from the perspective of the Source and is generally an active verb.

relatedFeature-2.title: relatedFeature
relatedFeature-2.description: A relatedFeature is a general structure used to define relationships between any features or objects within GeoSciML. Relationships are always binary and directional.  There is always a single source and a single target for a given FeatureRelation (which is abstract in GeoSciML Basic).  The relationship is always defined from the perspective of the Source and is generally an active verb.

relatedFeature-3.title: relatedFeature
relatedFeature-3.description: A relatedFeature is a general structure used to define relationships between any features or objects within GeoSciML. Relationships are always binary and directional.  There is always a single source and a single target for a given FeatureRelation (which is abstract in GeoSciML Basic).  The relationship is always defined from the perspective of the Source and is generally an active verb.

classifier-1.title: classifier
classifier-1.description: The classifier (<font color="#4f81bd">SWE::Category</font>) contains a standard description or definition of the feature type (e.g., the definition of a particular geologic unit in a stratigraphic lexicon).

classifier-2.title: classifier
classifier-2.description: The classifier (<font color="#4f81bd">SWE::Category</font>) contains a standard description or definition of the feature type (e.g., the definition of a particular geologic unit in a stratigraphic lexicon).

classifier-3.title: classifier
classifier-3.description: The classifier (<font color="#4f81bd">SWE::Category</font>) contains a standard description or definition of the feature type (e.g., the definition of a particular geologic unit in a stratigraphic lexicon).

geologicHistory-1.title: geologicHistory
geologicHistory-1.description: The geologicHistory is an association that relates one or more GeologicEvents to a GeologicFeature to describe their age or geologic history.  Normally, GeoSciML uses the generic relatedFeature::GeologicRelation to associate GeologicFeature with other GeologicFeatures, including GeologicEvent.  However, this design was deemed too complex for GeoSciML Basic and is therefore only available from the GeoSciML Extension package.

geologicHistory-2.title: geologicHistory
geologicHistory-2.description: The geologicHistory is an association that relates one or more GeologicEvents to a GeologicFeature to describe their age or geologic history.  Normally, GeoSciML uses the generic relatedFeature::GeologicRelation to associate GeologicFeature with other GeologicFeatures, including GeologicEvent.  However, this design was deemed too complex for GeoSciML Basic and is therefore only available from the GeoSciML Extension package.

geologicHistory-3.title: geologicHistory
geologicHistory-3.description: The geologicHistory is an association that relates one or more GeologicEvents to a GeologicFeature to describe their age or geologic history.  Normally, GeoSciML uses the generic relatedFeature::GeologicRelation to associate GeologicFeature with other GeologicFeatures, including GeologicEvent.  However, this design was deemed too complex for GeoSciML Basic and is therefore only available from the GeoSciML Extension package.

unitDescription-1.title: unitDescription
unitDescription-1.description: The unitDescription property is an association that links the geomorphologic feature to a geologic description (e.g., related stratigraphic units and earth materials).

unitDescription-2.title: unitDescription
unitDescription-2.description: The unitDescription property is an association that links the geomorphologic feature to a geologic description (e.g., related stratigraphic units and earth materials).

unitDescription-3.title: unitDescription
unitDescription-3.description: The unitDescription property is an association that links the geomorphologic feature to a geologic description (e.g., related stratigraphic units and earth materials).
